classes.description: Represents an educational institution such as an elementary, middle, or high school. Contains information about the school's name, type, ranking, and additional details to help evaluate the educational quality of a property's location.

source_http_request.comment: CRLF-formatted and JSON-stringified HTTPS request from which this data can be retrieved.

request_identifier.comment: Identifier value that should be substituted into the source HTTP request to retrieve this specific data.

grade_rating.comment: Letter grade rating for the school.

distance_miles.comment: Distance from the property to the school in miles.

description.comment: Additional description about the school's programs, reputation, or special features.

overall_district_rating.comment: Overall school district rating out of 10.

classes.description: Transportation and commute quality including walkability, highway access, and overall commute assessment.

source_http_request.comment: CRLF-formatted and JSON-stringified HTTPS request from which this data can be retrieved.

request_identifier.comment: Identifier value that should be substituted into the source HTTP request to retrieve this specific data.

walkability_score.comment: Walk Score rating for walkability to amenities.

walkability_description.comment: Description of walkable amenities and access.

major_highways.comment: List of major highways and their accessibility.

classes.description: Safety and security metrics including crime rates, emergency services response times, and overall safety assessments.

source_http_request.comment: CRLF-formatted and JSON-stringified HTTPS request from which this data can be retrieved.

request_identifier.comment: Identifier value that should be substituted into the source HTTP request to retrieve this specific data.

crime_rate.comment: Overall crime rate assessment for the area.

crime_rate_comparison.comment: Comparison to national average (e.g., '70% below national avg').

emergency_response_time.comment: Specific response time range (e.g., '5-7 min response time').

overall_safety_grade.comment: Overall safety grade for the area.

classes.description: Environmental factors, natural disaster risks, and surroundings that affect property desirability and safety.

source_http_request.comment: CRLF-formatted and JSON-stringified HTTPS request from which this data can be retrieved.

request_identifier.comment: Identifier value that should be substituted into the source HTTP request to retrieve this specific data.

fire_zone.comment: Wildfire risk zone or fire district designation indicating wildfire hazard level and emergency response district.

wildfire_risk_level.comment: Standardized wildfire risk assessment based on vegetation, weather patterns, topography, and fire history.

air_quality_index.comment: EPA Air Quality Index category indicating typical air pollution levels for the area.

air_quality_compliance.comment: Whether area is in attainment for all EPA ambient air quality standards.

noise_level.comment: Ambient noise level in the area affecting quality of life and property desirability.

noise_sources.comment: Specific sources of noise in the area.

light_pollution_level.comment: Light pollution level affecting night sky visibility and natural darkness.

earthquake_zone.comment: Seismic zone designation or earthquake risk classification for the area.

soil_stability.comment: Soil stability assessment considering factors like erosion, subsidence, and landslide risk.

environmental_hazards.comment: List of additional environmental hazards present in the area (e.g., 'Radon', 'Industrial Pollution', 'Mining Activity').

flood_risk_level.comment: Flood risk assessment based on FEMA flood zone data.

flood_zone_designation.comment: FEMA flood zone designation (e.g., 'Zone X', 'Zone AE').

flood_insurance_required.comment: Whether flood insurance is required for the property.

wind_storm_risk.comment: Wind storm and hurricane risk assessment.

hurricane_engineering_compliance.comment: Whether building is engineered for hurricane winds per current code.

radon_building_type_assessment.comment: Radon risk specific to building type (e.g., 'rarely an issue in low-rise wood frame condos').

environmental_surroundings.comment: Primary environmental setting surrounding the property.

beach_proximity.comment: Details about nearby beach access if applicable.

classes.description: Overall property ranking and assessment scores based on multiple factors including climate, safety, wellness, ambience, and location quality.

source_http_request.comment: CRLF-formatted and JSON-stringified HTTPS request from which this data can be retrieved.

request_identifier.comment: Identifier value that should be substituted into the source HTTP request to retrieve this specific data.

overall_ranking_score.comment: Overall property ranking score out of 100.

ranking_percentile.comment: Percentile ranking description (e.g., 'top 5% of similar listings').

classes.description: Represents a saved search criteria for home buyers. Contains search parameters like price range, property features (pets allowed, waterfront, etc.), and notification preferences to help buyers find properties that match their requirements.

listings_ids.comment: The IDs of the listings that match the search criteria

pets_allowed_indicator.comment: Pets allowed indicates that the property owner or management permits residents to have pets, such as dogs, cats, or other domestic animals.

water_front_indicator.comment: Waterfront indicates that the property has direct access to or is located near a body of water, such as a lake, river, ocean, or canal.

school_indicator.comment: School indicates that the property is located near an elementary, middle, or high school.

gated_community_indicator.comment: Gated community indicates that the property is enclosed by gates or walls and restricts access to residents and their guests.

private_pool_indicator.comment: Private pool indicates that the property has a private pool.

garage_spaces_indicator.comment: Refers to the number of parking spaces available within a garage on the property.

price_drop_indicator.comment: Show listed properties in descending order indicator.

featured_indicator.comment: The status of the validation provider.

email_frequency.comment: The frequency of tracking the buy search the customer desired.

current_list_price_min.comment: The minimum current list price of the property. This allows for filtering properties with a list price greater than or equal to the specified amount.

current_list_price_max.comment: The maximum current list price of the property. This allows for filtering properties with a list price less than or equal to the specified amount.

has_person.comment: The person ID who performed the search

classes.description: Represents a property that has been saved or liked by a user. Tracks user preferences and allows users to maintain a list of properties they are interested in for future reference.

listing_id.comment: The ID of the listing that was saved

liked_indicator.comment: Indicates whether the property was liked by the user

has_person.comment: The person ID who performed the search

has_property.comment: Indicates that a customer Like a specific property.

search_shorten_url.comment: the shorten link of the liked properties

has_person.comment: The person ID who performed the search

email_frequency.comment: The frequency of tracking the sell search the customer desired .

has_person.comment: The person ID who performed the search

has_address.comment: The address ID of the property the customer is selling.

email_frequency.comment: The frequency of tracking the sell search the customer desired .

credit_score.comment: The credit score of the customer.

usage_type.comment: Property usage type the customer is willing to buy

monthly_payment.comment: Amount of payment customer is willing to pay monthly.

has_person.comment: The person ID who performed the search

address_bar_code_image.comment: Contains a staircase blob identifier to an image of an address bar code.

indicia_image.comment: Contains a staircase blob identifier to an indicia image.

tray_label.comment: Label representing tray ID assigned by USPS.

has_customer_contact.comment: Describes details about an interaction with a customer.

classes.comment: Provides deatils on people who have requested that Staircase no longer targets them for solicitation.

unsubscribe_reason.comment: Indicates the reason why a person has requested to no longer receive communications from Staircase.

unsubscribe_timestamp.comment: The date and time that a person requested to no longer receive communications from Staircase.

unsubscribe_identifier.comment: Indicates the source of the unsubscribe request.

credit_summary_name.comment: Provides a descriptive identifier for a set of credit-related data aggregated within a credit summary.

has_credit_summary_data_set.comment: Refers to a collection of related data elements that together provide specific information about a particular aspect of an individual's credit profile.

estimated_cash_out_amount.comment: The estimated amount of cash that the borrower may receive at closing based on a calculation agreed to by the parties to the transaction.

refinance_program_type_other_description.comment: A free-form text field to capture additional detail when 'other' is selected for the refinance program type.

total_prior_lien_payoff_amount.comment: The total dollar amount of the refinance proceeds that is applied to liens on the subject property. In most cases, this refers to the existing mortgage on the property being refinanced.

current_first_mortgage_holder_type.comment: Specifies the investor holding the first mortgage that is being refinanced.

current_first_mortgage_holder_type_other.comment: A free-form text field used to capture the enumeration when Other is selected for the current first mortgage holder.

data_set_name.comment: A specific identifier that describes the type of credit information contained within that data set.

data_set_value.comment: Refers to the actual data or measurement corresponding to a specific DataSetName.

google_validation_indicator.comment: Indicates whether the address has been validated by Google.

usps_validation_indicator.comment: Indicates whether the address has been validated by the United States Postal Service (USPS).

validation_datetime.comment: The date and time that the address was validated.

classes.description: An unnormalized address schema containing raw address data as typically found in source systems before standardization or parsing into individual components.

full_address.comment: The street address of the property including street number, street name, city, and state and postal code. Format: '123 Main, Springfield, IL' or '456 Oak Ave, Chicago, IL 1003'.

source_http_request.comment: CRLF-formatted and JSON-stringified HTTPS request from which this data can be retrieved.

request_identifier.comment: Identifier value that should be substituted into the source HTTP request to retrieve this specific data.

county_jurisdiction.comment: The name of the county or local jurisdiction that has authority over the property for tax assessment and administrative purposes. Should not include the word 'County' in the value.

classes.description: Represents a physical or mailing address with comprehensive location details including street information, postal codes and geographic identifiers.

source_http_request.comment: CRLF-formatted and JSON-stringified HTTPS request from which this data can be retrieved.

request_identifier.comment: Identifier value that should be substituted into the source HTTP request to retrieve this specific data.

full_address_slug.comment: A URL-friendly string derived from the full address by replacing non-alphanumeric characters (e.g., spaces, punctuation) with dashes.

address_format_type.comment: Address format type refers to the different conventions or standards used to structure and format addresses in various countries or regions.

address_identifier.comment: An address identifier is a unique alphanumeric string used to identify a specific address.

address_line_1.comment: Address line 1 is the first line of the address where the primary information for locating a specific location or recipient is provided.

address_line_2.comment: Address line 2 is the second line of the address where the primary information for locating a specific location or recipient is provided.

address_line_3.comment: Address line 3 is the third line of the address where the primary information for locating a specific location or recipient is provided.

address_type.comment: Address type is a classification or categorization of an address based on its purpose or characteristics.

address_type_other_description.comment: If an address type is 'other,' address type other description provides more details on the address type.

address_unit_designator_type.comment: Address unit designator type describes the category that a specific unit belongs to.

attention_to_name.comment: An attention to name on an address is an optional line that can be included in an address to indicate the name of a specific person or department within an organization to whom the mail is intended.

carrier_route_code.comment: A carrier route code is a unique identifier assigned by the United States Postal Service (USPS) to a specific mail delivery route or group of addresses serviced by a single mail carrier.

cbsa_code.comment: A CBSA code is a Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA) code, which is a unique identifier assigned to specific ports, airports, or border crossing points in Canada. The CBSA code helps facilitate the import/export process and customs clearance activities at these designated locations.

census_block_group_identifier.comment: A single digit number which is the first digit of all the blocks which comprise the block group. A statistical subdivision of a census tract, a block group is the smallest geographic unit for which the Census Bureau tabulates sample data. Example: block g

census_block_identifier.comment: A four-digit number to identify a census block. A subdivision of a census tract, a block is the smallest geographic unit for which the Census Bureau tabulates 100-percent data. Many blocks correspond to individual city blocks bounded by streets, but block

census_tract_base_identifier.comment: A four-digit number used to identify a census tract. A census tract is a small, relatively permanent statistical subdivision of a county delineated by a local committee of census data users for the purpose of presenting data. Census tract numbers are alwa

census_tract_identifier.comment: Identifies census tract as defined by the U.S. Census Bureau where subject property is located.

census_tract_suffix_identifier.comment: Census tract suffixes may range from 01 to 98. Many census tracts do not have a suffix; in such cases, the suffix field is either left blank or is zero-filled. The decimal point separating the four-digit basic tract number from the two-digit suffix is sho

city_name.comment: City name refers to the name of the city in which the address is located.

congressional_district_identifier.comment: A two-digit numeric code to identify each Congressional District within a State. These codes are unique within each State. A congressional district identifies an electoral constituency that elects a single member of a congress.

core_based_statistical_area_code.comment: A five digit code representing a functional region based around an urban center of at least 10,000 people, based on standards published by the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) in 2000. The CBSA code refers collectively to metropolitan and micropolita

core_based_statistical_area_division_cod.comment: Metropolitan Divisions are defined within Metropolitan Statistical Areas that have a single core with a population of at least 2.5 million. Not all Metropolitan Statistical Areas with urbanized areas of this size will contain Metropolitan Divisions. Metro

country_code.comment: Country code is a code that represents the country in which the address is located.

country_name.comment: Country name refers to the name of the country in which the address is located.

county_code.comment: County code is a code that represents the county in which the address is located.

county_name.comment: County name refers to the name of the county in which the address is located.

created_datetime.comment: Created_datetime describes when an address was created in a system.

delivery_point_bar_code.comment: A Delivery Point Barcode (DPBC) is a barcode used by the United States Postal Service (USPS) to facilitate the automated sorting and delivery of mail. It contains encoded information that helps identify the specific delivery point or address to which mail should be delivered.

delivery_point_bar_code_check.comment: A Delivery Point Barcode (DPBC) check is a verification process used to ensure the accuracy and validity of a Delivery Point Barcode, which is a barcode used by the United States Postal Service (USPS) to automate the sorting and delivery of mail.

fips_country_code.comment: A unique two letter alpha code to identify each country. These Country codes are part of the Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS), an official coding system developed by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST, formerly the National Bureau of Standards), U.S. Department of Commerce, and maintained by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS)Renamed. Used to be Country FIPS Code.

fips_county_code.comment: Code identifying the county. (Designator Code based on Federal Information Processing Standard Publication 6-4)Renamed. Used to be County FIPS Code.

fips_county_subdivision_code.comment: The Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) County Subdivision Code identifies all county subdivisions in the 50 states, District of Columbia and Puerto Rico. The Minor Civil Division (MCD) and Census County Division (CCD) are geocodes that are part of the FIPS 55 system, developed by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) and now maintained by the U.S. Geological Survey. The FIPS 55 system identifies named entities with a unique five-digit numeric locality code. The FIPS 55 locality codes identify governmentally functioning MCDs within a numeric range from 00001 to 89999. The codes in this range also represent incorporated places, Census Designated Places (CDP), and Alaska Native and American Indian areas, together with other entities not included in the tabulations of the decennial census, such as named localities, military installations, and National Parks. All these entity names are combined and listed in a single alphabetic sequence. The FIPS code range, 90000 to 98999, is reserved for CCDs and nonfunctioning MCDs where they cover whole States, whole counties, or their statistically equivalent entities.

fips_county_subdivision_name.comment: The formal name or description for a county subdivision that is referenced by the FIPS County Subdivision Code. For example, Jones Township.

fips_place_code.comment: A five-digit numeric code assigned by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), and maintained by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), to identify populated places, primary county divisions, and other locational entities within a State. The NIST assigns the codes based on the alphabetic sequence of the entity names; it documents the codes in FIPS PUB 55. This information is used by the US Census Bureau.

fips_place_name.comment: The formal name of a statistical entity as defined by the by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), and maintained by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), that is referenced by the FIPS Place Code. Place includes Census Bureau designated places, consolidated cities, and incorporated places. This is also represented by the 5-digit FIPS Place Code. This information is used by the US Census Bureau.

fips_state_alpha_code.comment: A unique two letter alpha code to identify each State and State equivalent entity. These State codes are part of the Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS), an official coding system developed by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST, formerly the National Bureau of Standards), U.S. Department of Commerce, and maintained by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS). The FIPS state alpha code for each U.S. states and the District of Columbia is identical to the postal abbreviations by the United States Postal Service. Since September 3, 1987, the same has been true of the alpha code for each of the outlying areas, with the exception of U.S. Minor Outlying Islands (UM) as the USPS routes mail for these islands indirectly.Renamed. Used to be State FIPS Alpha Code.

fips_state_numeric_code.comment: A unique two digit numeric code to identify each State and State equivalent entity. These State codes are part of the Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS), an official coding system developed by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST, formerly the National Bureau of Standards), U.S. Department of Commerce, and maintained by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS).Renamed. Used to be State FIPS Numeric Code.

full_address.comment: A full address includes all the necessary information to identify and locate a specific location or recipient.

highway_contract_route_identifier.comment: A highway contract route (HCR) identifier is a unique code assigned to a specific highway contract route used for mail transportation by the United States Postal Service (USPS).

judicial_district_name.comment: The name of the Judicial District in which the subject property resides.

judicial_division_name.comment: The name of the Judicial Division in which the subject property resides.

last_updated_datetime.comment: Last_updated_datetime describes when an address was last updated in a system.

latitude.comment: Latitude is a coordinate that specifies the north-south position of a point on the Earth's surface. It is an angular measurement, usually expressed in degrees, with values ranging from -90째 at the South Pole to +90째 at the North Pole.

longitude.comment: Longitude is a coordinate that specifies the east-west position of a point on the Earth's surface. It is an angular measurement, usually expressed in degrees, with values ranging from -180째 to +180째.

mail_stop_code.comment: A mail stop code, also known as a mail code or department code, is a unique identifier used within an organization to facilitate the sorting and delivery of internal mail or correspondence. It is primarily used in large organizations where there may be multiple departments or units located in the same physical location.

map_reference_identifier.comment: A reference to a regionally specific map document that assists in locating a property. May refer to locally available published map products (e.g. Thomas Map in CA) or a county tax map.

map_reference_second_identifier.comment: A secondary reference to a regionally specific map document that assists in locating a property. May refer to locally available published map products (e.g. Thomas Map in CA) or a county tax map.

metropolitan_division_identifier.comment: A unique alphanumeric string identifying the Metropolitan Division (MD) where the property is located. An MD is a sub part of an MSA (Metropolitan Statistical Area).

msa_identifier.comment: Identifies Metropolitan Statistical Area (MSA) where subject property is located. A MSA is a contiguous geographic area consisting of an urban center city and its surrounding suburbs.

municipality_name.comment: The name of the municipality in which property is located.

plus_four_postal_code.comment: A postal code plus four, also known as a ZIP code plus four (in the United States) is a numerical extension to a postal code.

plus_four_postal_code_type.comment: The plus_four_postal_code_type field, assigned by USPS (United States Postal Service), is used to categorize and define the type of address by indicating whether it includes an extended four-digit code, facilitating mail sorting and delivery in the United States.

post_office_box_identifier.comment: A post office box identifier refers to the unique number or alphanumeric code assigned to an individual or organization's post office box (PO Box) for receiving mail at a post office facility.

postal_code.comment: A postal code, also known as a ZIP code (in the United States) or postcode (in many other countries), is a numerical code used by postal services to identify specific geographic areas for efficient mail sorting and delivery.

recording_jurisdiction_name.comment: The name of the Recording Jurisdiction in which the subject property resides.

recording_jurisdiction_type_other_descri.comment: The description of the Recording Jurisdiction Type when Other is selected from the enumerated list.

rural_route_box_identifier.comment: A rural route box identifier, also known as an RR box identifier, is a number or alphanumeric code assigned to a mailbox or mail receptacle on a rural route.

rural_route_identifier.comment: A rural route identifier, also known as an RR identifier, is a number or alphanumeric code assigned to a specific rural route for mail delivery. In rural areas, where homes and businesses are often spread out over long distances, a rural route is a designated path followed by mail carriers to deliver mail to multiple addresses along that route.

school_district_name.comment: The name of the school district in which the property is located.

sequence_number.comment: An address sequence number is a unique numerical identifier assigned to an address within a specific sequence or order. It is used to indicate the position or sequence of an address within a given range or list.

state_code.comment: State code is a code that represents the state in which the address is located.

state_name.comment: State name refers to the name of the state in which the address is located.

street_name.comment: A street name is the name of a street on which an address is located.

street_post_directional_text.comment: Street post directional text refers to the directional indicator or suffix added to a street name to provide additional information about the direction or orientation of the street segment. It helps to clarify the position of a particular street in relation to other streets or landmarks in a given area.

street_pre_directional_text.comment: Street pre directional text refers to the directional indicator or prefix added to a street name to provide additional information about the direction or orientation of the street segment. It helps to clarify the position of a particular street in relation to other streets or landmarks in a given area.

street_primary_number.comment: Street primary number refers to the numerical part of a street address that indicates the specific location or position of a building or property along a street.

street_number.comment: Street  number refers to the numerical part of a street address that indicates the specific location or position of a building or property along a street.

street_suffix.comment: A street suffix, also known as a street type or street name suffix, is a word or abbreviation that follows the street name in an address, indicating the type or category of the street (e.g., Drive, Circle, Boulevard).

unincorporated_area_name.comment: Area where the property resides if it is not incorporated into a city, town, village, etc.

unit_identifier.comment: A unit identifier is a reference to the specific unit, suite, apartment, or other secondary identifier associated with an address. It is used to differentiate individual units within a larger building or complex.

township.comment: A township is a 6-mile by 6-mile square of land, covering 36 square miles. Townships are numbered north or south from a designated baseline. In this case, Township 45 refers to the 45th tier of townships from the baseline.

range.comment: A range describes the east-west position of a township relative to a principal meridian. Range 24E means the township is located 24 tiers east of the principal meridian

section.comment: Each township is divided into 36 sections, with each section being 1 square mile (640 acres). Section 03 refers to the third section within its township

block.comment: A block is a further subdivision within a plat (a recorded land division), often used in urban or planned developments. Block 0000G refers to a specific block within that recorded subdivision

example.source_http_request:
GET /Property/Details?parcelId={{request_identifier}} HTTP/1.1
Host: pbcpao.gov
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Connection: keep-alive

has_address_validation.comment: The 'has_address_validation' property links an address to a specific address validation record. This connection provides details about the validation process and the results of the validation.

advertiser_language.comment: Advertiser language refers to the language that the advertiser uses, where language refers to schemas, classes, properties, and requirements related to communicating with the advertiser via API.

advertiser_name.comment: An advertiser name is a unique label given to a advertiser to distinguish it from other advertisers in the Staircase platform. An advertiser name reflects the purpose of the advertiser, and is often designed to be easy to remember and to quickly identify the advertiser.

redirect_url.comment: A redirect URL is a web address that automatically forwards users to a different web page or website. When a user clicks on a redirect URL, the web server hosting the original web page will automatically send a request to the server hosting the target web page, and the user's browser will be redirected to the new page.

has_product_configuration.comment: Product configuration refers to the process of customizing a product to meet specific customer needs and requirements.

api_scenario_identifier.comment: An API scenario identifier is a unique code or string of characters assigned to a specific API scenario that is used to uniquely identify and access that API scenario.

description.comment: Taxes are fees levied by federal, state, and local governments on income, goods and services, and property, among other things. There are several types of taxes in the United States, such as property tax, income tax, sales tax, payroll tax, excise tax and estate tax.

name.comment: The API schema field name refers to the identifier or label assigned to a specific attribute or property within the schema definition of an Application Programming Interface (API).

profile_name.comment: A profile name is a unique label used to group API scenarios.

scenario_type.comment: A scenario type is the type or category to which an API scenario belongs.

has_product_api.comment: The 'has_product_api' property links an invocation to a specific product API that is being accessed or utilized during the invocation. This connection provides details about the API and its role in the invocation process

has_request_collection.comment: A request collection provides an example request as required by an API. It helps developers by offering a practical demonstration on how to send a request to the API. API requests are the primary means by which developers interact with APIs to retrieve data, send data, or perform actions.

has_response_collection.comment: A response collection provides an example response as returned by an API. It offers developers a clear understanding of the structure and format of the data that will be returned by the API.

has_sample_transaction_identifier.comment: An API scenario schema describes the schema and provides sample data for a specific product API scenario.

name.comment: The API schema field name refers to the identifier or label assigned to a specific attribute or property within the schema definition of an Application Programming Interface (API).

requirement_indicator.comment: An API schema field requirement indicator refers to a symbol or notation used within the schema definition of an Application Programming Interface (API) to denote whether a field is mandatory or not.

has_api_schema_field.comment: The API schema defines a composition or inclusion of one field within another field.

has_graph_entity.comment: The 'has_graph_entity' property establishes a relationship between an invocation and a specific entity within a graph structure. This link can be used to represent the influence or impact of the invocation on various nodes or entities within a system's graph architecture

console_app_url.comment: The console app URL is a web link that points to a console application or interactive environment where the api schema can be displeyed

schema_type.comment: An API schema type describes the structure and behavior of an API according to type: either request or response.

has_api_schema_field.comment: The API schema defines a composition or inclusion of one field within another field.

has_product_api.comment: The 'has_product_api' property links an invocation to a specific product API that is being accessed or utilized during the invocation. This connection provides details about the API and its role in the invocation process

description.comment: Taxes are fees levied by federal, state, and local governments on income, goods and services, and property, among other things. There are several types of taxes in the United States, such as property tax, income tax, sales tax, payroll tax, excise tax and estate tax.

name.comment: The API schema field name refers to the identifier or label assigned to a specific attribute or property within the schema definition of an Application Programming Interface (API).

appliance_type.comment: Refers to the type of appliance.

appliance_type_other_description.comment: A free-form field to capture additional detail when Other is selected for the appliance type.

asset_account_identifier.comment: A unique alphanumeric string identifying an asset.

asset_account_in_name_of_description.comment: The name of the persons or entity(ies) in whose name the account is held.

asset_account_type_other_description.comment: A free-form text field used to collect additional information when other is selected for asset_account_type.

asset_cash_or_market_value_amount.comment: The cash or market value amount of the asset_type. The market value is the price at which an asset is transferred between a willing buyer and a willing seller. Market value and cash values tend to be equal.

asset_description.comment: A text description that further defines the Asset. This could be used to describe the shares associated with the stocks, bonds or mutual funds, retirement funds or business owned that the borrower has disclosed (named) as an asset.

asset_liquidity_indicator.comment: When true, indicates that the asset is classified as liquid. When false, indicates that the asset is classified as non liquid.

asset_net_value_amount.comment: The cash or market value of the asset less any outstanding liabilities or obligations.

asset_statement_date.comment: The date on which the asset statement was issued.

asset_type_other_description.comment: A free-form text field used to collect additional information when Other is selected as the Asset Type.

automobile_make_description.comment: A free-form text field used to capture the make and model of borrower's vehicle disclosed as asset. Collected on the URLA in Section VI Assets (Automobiles Owned).

automobile_model_year.comment: A field used to capture the model year of borrower's vehicle disclosed as asset. Collected on the URLA in Section VI Assets (Automobiles Owned).

currency_code.comment:
currency code in mortgage banking expenses refers to a standardized code that identifies the type of currency being used. 
The currency code is typically an alphabetic code consisting of 3 letters, and is used to represent the currency symbol for transactions in the international financial market. The currency code is used to ensure the accurate exchange and conversion of currency in mortgage banking transactions, and helps to eliminate confusion and avoid errors in financial transactions. Some examples of currency codes include USD for US dollars, EUR for euros, and GBP for British pounds.

freddie_mac_updated_indicator.comment:
Freddie Mac updated indicator refers to a binary (yes/no) field that indicates whether Freddie Mac, also known as the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation (FHLMC), has updated its records related to a particular liability. 
Freddie Mac is rdf:type government-sponsored enterprise (GSE) that provides liquidity, stability, and affordability to the U.S. housing market by purchasing mortgages from banks and other lending institutions.

The Freddie Mac updated indicator is used to determine if the information about rdf:type particular liability, such as an outstanding mortgage loan, is up-to-date. This information can be used by mortgage banking institutions to make decisions about loan applications, approve or deny loans, and set interest rates. The Freddie Mac updated indicator is also used for reporting and performance evaluations.

The specific definitions and uses of the Freddie Mac updated indicator can vary by company and jurisdiction.

funds_source_type_other_description.comment: A free-form text field that specifies the enumeration when the value of other is used for funds_source_type.

included_in_asset_account_indicator.comment: When true, indicates the dollar value of that item is included in the value of an asset account being reported by a borrower.

life_insurance_face_value_amount.comment: The dollar amount of the face value of the borrower's Life Insurance. The face value is the par value or actual selling price of the asset or the amount the issuer contracts to repay. (Collected on the URLA in Section VI (Assets - Face Amount Life Insurance).

market_value_amount.comment:
market value amount refers to the estimated value of a mortgage loan or a portfolio of mortgage loans based on current market conditions. 

This value is determined by taking into consideration rdf:type variety of factors, including the creditworthiness of the borrower, the terms of the loan, and current market conditions, such as interest rates and economic trends. 
The market value amount is an important metric in mortgage banking, as it helps lenders and investors assess the value of their mortgage assets and make informed decisions about their portfolios. 
The market value amount is also used to determine the amount of collateral that rdf:type lender can expect to recover in the event of rdf:type default, which helps to determine the risk associated with rdf:type loan.

owners_of_record_description.comment:
owner of record description refers to the individual or entity that is listed as the owner of a mortgage loan in the official records of the lender or servicer. 

This information is used to identify the rightful owner of the mortgage loan and to ensure that payments and other transactions related to the loan are properly credited and tracked. 
The owner of record is typically the lender that originated the loan, but it can also be an investor that has purchased the loan or rdf:type servicer that is managing the loan on behalf of the owner. 
The description of the owner of record is important for maintaining accurate records and for ensuring that all parties involved in the mortgage loan process have rdf:type clear understanding of who is responsible for the loan.

stock_bond_mutual_fund_share_count.comment: The number of shares associated with the stocks or bonds that the borrower has disclosed (named) as an asset. Collected on the URLA in Section VI Assets (Stocks and Bonds).

verified_indicator.comment: Flag to indicate if asset value has been verified based on trading partner rules and definitions.

gifted_or_granted_from.comment: A relationship that indicates an asset was provided by a person in the form of a gift or grant. It connects the asset to the person who was the giver or grantor.

possessed_by.comment: The individual who legally owns or has control over this asset.

company_identifier.comment: A company identifier is a unique code or string of characters assigned to a Staircase company.  The identifier is generated remotely and used to uniquely identify that company.

has_company_identifier.comment: A company identifier is a unique code or string of characters assigned to a Staircase company.  The identifier is generated remotely and used to uniquely identify that company.

has_person_identifier.comment: A person identifier is a unique code or string of characters assigned to a Staircase employee or other person who works in a Staircase work week. The identifier is used to uniquely identify that person.

has_work_week_identifier.comment: A work week identifier refers to a work week transaction identifier. The identifier is used to uniquely identify that work week.

person_identifier.comment: A person identifier is a unique code or string of characters assigned to a Staircase employee or other person who works in a Staircase work week. The identifier is generated remotely and used to uniquely identify that person.

total_points_delivered.comment: Total points delivered indicates the number of points delivered by a person for the associated work week.

total_tasks_completed.comment: Total tasks completed indicates the number of tasks completed by a person in the associated work week.

work_week_identifier.comment: A work week identifier refers to a work week transaction identifier. The identifier is used to uniquely identify that work week.

authorization_timestamp.comment: Authorization_timestamp refers to the date and time that the person granted the authorization.

authorization_type.comment: Authorization_type_enumerations refers to the type of authorization that the user granted, such as a soft credit pull or hard credit pull.

authorized_by.comment: Authorized_by refers to the person who granted an authorization.

captured_by_bot.comment: Captured_by_bot refers to the bot that captured the authorization that the person granted.

captured_by_person.comment: Captured_by_person refers to the person who captured the authorization that the person granted.

message_description.comment: Text sent as part of a message from an automated underwriting system.

message_group_type.comment: A category of messages sent by an automated underwriting system.

message_section_identifier.comment: Refers to a section in an automated underwriting system message.

message_subcategory_name.comment: Refers to the name of a subcategory in an automated underwriting system message.

message_value.comment: The message and the review rules derived during the loan validation process by the automated underwriting system.

response_message_group_category_name.comment: Category name for the automated underwriting system response message.

has_automated_underwriting_system.comment: An automated underwriting system refers to the process by which computer algorithms and software systems evaluate the risks involved in insuring a particular client or granting a loan to a borrower.

has_document.comment: A document is a written or printed record that contains information, data, or instructions in a fixed form that can be stored, transmitted, or communicated.

a_minus_caution_fee_level_description.comment: The A minus caution fee level description is used by the lender to provide additional information about the risk associated with a particular loan, and to help the lender make informed decisions about loan approvals and risk management.

asset_representation_and_warranty_relief.comment: Asset representation and warranty relief eligibility type is the eligibility of a mortgage loan for relief from certain representations and warranties made by the borrower and the lender.

aus_case_identifier.comment: A unique identifier assigned by the underwriting system to the underwriting case for a specific loan application.

aus_decision_datetime.comment: The date and time of the underwriting decision.

aus_document_waiver_indicator.comment: Indicates that some or all of the loan information is not required to be formally documented in the loan submission package, e.g., no requirement to provide a wage statement, tax returns, etc.

aus_eligibility_type.comment: Evaluation by an Automated Underwriting System (AUS) as either eligible for a loan or ineligible.

aus_evaluation_status_description.comment: The status of the automated underwriting certificate request.

aus_is_out_of_scope_indicator.comment: The is_out_of_scope_indicator is used to alert the lender that the loan cannot be evaluated using the AUS and requires manual underwriting.

aus_method_version_identifier.comment: Specifies the version of the automated underwriting system used to underwrite the loan.

aus_process_description.comment: A free-form text description of the automated underwriting process used on the loan.

aus_purchase_eligibility_type.comment: Refers to a loan's eligibility for purchase.

aus_recommendation_description.comment: The loan approval recommendation determined by the automated underwriting system.

aus_recommendation_type.comment: Refers to the outcome of a loan application's evaluation by an Automated Underwriting System (AUS).

aus_result_value.comment: The result of the automated underwriting evaluation system.

aus_service_engine_transaction_identifie.comment: Automated Underwriting System (AUS) service engine transaction identifier is a unique identifier assigned to a mortgage loan transaction by the lender's AUS system.

aus_submission_count.comment: Submission count is the number of times a loan application has been submitted to an Automated Underwriting System (AUS) for evaluation.

aus_transaction_identifier.comment: AUS (Automated Underwriting System) transaction identifier is a unique identifier assigned to each transaction that is processed through an Automated Underwriting System (AUS).

aus_type.comment: A value from a MISMO prescribed list that represents the automated underwriting system used to evaluate a loan.

aus_type_other_description.comment: A free-form text field used to collect additional information when Other is selected for aus_type.

collateral_representation_and_warranty_r.comment: Refers to the specific representations and warranties related to the collateral that are eligible for relief based on the loan characteristics and lender underwriting guidelines.
Refers to the eligibility of a lender to receive relief from the representations and warranties made abou tthe collateral (property) used to secure a mortgage loan.

fha_pre_review_results_value.comment: The credit risk decision issued by the FHA TOTAL Mortgage Scorecard based solely on the algorithm score. (Does not take into account review rules or credit overrides.)

fha_total_mortgage_scorecard_indicator.comment: The FHA total mortgage scorecard indicator is rdf:type numeric score that ranges from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating lower risk to the FHA.

income_representation_and_warranty_relie.comment: Refers to the eligibility of a lender to receive relief from the representations and warranties made about borrower income.

loan_prospector_credit_risk_classificati.comment: The Loan Prospector credit risk classification for a loan.

loan_prospector_documentation_classifica.comment: The Loan Prospector documentation classification for a loan.

has_aus_request.comment: A link back to the request data used to generate this response.

has_document.comment: A document is a written or printed record that contains information, data, or instructions in a fixed form that can be stored, transmitted, or communicated.

has_loan.comment: A loan timeline is a chronological record capturing the progression and changes of loan attributes over time.

staircase_blob_identifier.comment: A blob identifier with content for the template.

template_engine.comment: The template engine used to render the template.

campaign_identifier.comment: An campaign identifier is a unique identifier for the campaign.

campaign_type.comment: A classification that designates the primary focus of a marketing or advertising effort within the real estate sector.

has_front_pdf_template.comment: A front PDF template is a pre-designed document that can be used as a starting point for creating a new document.

has_back_pdf_template.comment: A back PDF template is a pre-designed document that can be used as a starting point for creating a new document.

has_back_text_template.comment: A back text template is a pre-designed document that can be used as a starting point for creating a new document.

has_front_text_template.comment: A front text template is a pre-designed document that can be used as a starting point for creating a new document.

has_front_image.comment: A front image is a graphical representation or visual element that is displayed on the front of a document.

has_campaign_prompt.comment: A campaign prompt is an instruction provided to a bot or automated system to gather specific information or perform particular actions related to a marketing or advertising campaign.

has_campaign_knowledge_base.comment: A campaign knowledge base provides access to information, data, and resources used to support and enhance the execution of marketing and advertising campaigns.

has_customer_contact.comment: Describes details about an interaction with a customer.

reaches.comment: The number of times the insight has been viewed.

likes.comment: The number of likes the insight has received.

shares.comment: The number of times the insight has been shared.

follows.comment: The number of times the insight has been followed.

profile_visits.comment: The number of times the insight has been visited.

replies.comment: The number of replies the insight has received.

navigation.comment: The number of times the insight has been navigated.

clicks.comment: The number of times the link has been clicked.

views.comment: The number of times the insight has been viewed.

average_play_time.comment: The average play time of the insight.

has_campaign.comment: The campaign that the insight is associated with.

text_prompt.comment: A text-based instruction provided to a bot or automated system to gather specific information or perform particular actions related to a marketing or advertising campaign.

image_prompt.comment: Contains a staircase blob identifier, which points to an image used as part of a prompt in a marketing or advertising campaign.

codex_link.comment: Contains a link to a codex article containing a knowledge base article used in the campaign

automobile_identifier.comment: An automobile identifier is a unique identifier for the automobile (e.g., Vehicle Identification Number/VIN).

automobile_type.comment: An automobile type is the type or category to which an automobile belongs. (e.g., sedan, SUV, pickup).

brand_history.comment: A brief account of the origin, evolution, and significant milestones associated with the brand.

brand_name.comment: A unique name associated with the brand, often used to distinguish it from other brands in the market.

logo_blob_identifier.comment: A graphical symbol or emblem that represents the brand and helps in its visual recognition.

tagline.comment: A memorable phrase or sentence used in advertising and marketing to convey the essence or ethos of the brand.

base_path.comment: Refers to a root directory or a primary path under which all the files related to the bundle are stored and organized.

bundle_type.comment: Indicates the type of files the bundle contains and the general purpose of the bundle.

has_product.comment: The 'has_product' property connects an invocation to a specific product or service that is being affected or manipulated through the invocation. This relationship can help in understanding the interaction between the invocation and the corresponding product

author_role.comment: The role of the author of this message.

message_datetime.comment: The date and time at which the message was sent.

chat_related_to.comment: Another chat message to which this message is related.

has_document.comment: A document is a written or printed record that contains information, data, or instructions in a fixed form that can be stored, transmitted, or communicated.

note_datetime.comment: The date and time at which the note was sent.

has_related_entities.comment: Data classes related to the note.

thread_created_at.comment: The date and time at which the thread was created.

closing_adjustment_item_amount.comment: Cost associated with a closing adjustment item.

closing_adjustment_item_type.comment: Refers to a specific type of closing cost item that either adds a cost to, or subtracts a cost from, closing costs.

integrated_disclosure_cash_to_close_item.comment: Total cost related to a category of closing costs in a closing disclosure.
The category in which costs related to closing are grouped. This item type appears as a 'total' on a closing costs integrated disclosure.

integrated_disclosure_section_type.comment: Refers to a specific category of closing costs such as prepaids and services you can shop for. This section type appears on a closing costs integrated disclosure.

has_escrow_item.comment: Refers to an escrow item that is part of the closing costs.

has_fee.comment: Refers to a charge or cost associated with obtaining or servicing a mortgage loan.

has_prepaid_item.comment: Refers to an item that the borrower prepaid as part of the closing costs.

closing_cost_expiration_date.comment: The date on which the closing costs agreement between a borrower and a lender expires.

has_closing_adjustment_item.comment: Item provided in a closing disclosure that either adds a cost to, or subtracts a cost from, closing costs.

collection_identifier.comment: A collection identifier is a unique code used to identify a collection of data elements that are part of either a Staircase product request or response schema.

created_at.comment: Created_at refers to the date and time when a transaction was created.

fuzzy_searchable_indicator.comment: A fuzzy_searchable_indicator identifies if a transaction can be associated with a fuzzy search. A fuzzy search is a type of search algorithm that allows for approximate matching of search terms or phrases. Unlike exact search, where the search terms must match the query exactly to return results, fuzzy search takes into account possible spelling mistakes, variations in word order, and other minor variations in the query.

has_transaction.comment: Indicates the transaction(s) related to a particular entity.

serialise_to_graph_indicator.comment: A serialize_to_graph_indicator identifies if a transaction can be converted from a standard data structure into a graph data structure. Data to graph serialization is a process where data structures are converted into graph-based nodes and edges, which represent the data and the relationships between the data, respectively. This allows the data to be represented in a graph database, which can be used to store, query, and analyze large amounts of connected data.

updated_at.comment: Updated_at refers to the date and time when a collection was updated.

validation_indicator.comment: A validation indicator indicates whether a collection contains all of the data elements needed to successfully invoke a product API.

version.comment: Version refers to the Staircase language version with which the collection was created.

lexicon_version.comment: Lexicon_version refers to the version of the Staircase lexicon used to create the collection. Represents bundle ID of lexicon in Staircase Marketplace.

lexicon_hash.comment: Lexicon_hash refers to the hash value of the Staircase lexicon used to create the collection.

has_collections_link.comment: A collection can be linked to other Staircase collections. Typically request and response collections that are generated during a mortgage product flow are linked together.

has_data.comment: The 'has_data' property links a Staircase collection to an instance derived from any entity defined in the Staircase lexicon namespace. This relationship represents that the collection contains data elements associated with the specific entity instance, enabling the organization and structuring of data elements within the collection.

has_link.comment: A collection can be linked to other Staircase collections. Typically request and response collections that are generated during a mortgage product flow are linked together.

has_transaction.comment: Indicates the transaction(s) related to a particular entity.

has_collection_from.comment: Has_collection_from refers to the source or 'parent' collection from which the relationship is initiated.

has_collection_to.comment: Has_collection_to refers to the target or 'child' collection which is the object being related to or affected by the source object.

label.comment: Label refers to a description or identifier assigned to a specific field in software called Desktop Underwriter. Labels in Desktop Underwriter provide clear indications of what information is expected to be entered in each field. They help guide users through the loan application process by providing context and specifying the type of data required.

api_key.comment: An API key is a unique identifier used to authenticate and authorize access to an API. This key is stored in encrypted format for security purposes.

api_name.comment: API name refers to the name of a partner API.

auth_url.comment: An authorization URL is a specific URL that is used to initiate the process of authorizing access to a particular resource or service. When a user wants to access a resource or service that requires authorization, they are redirected to the authorization URL, where they are prompted to authenticate themselves and grant permissions to access the resource or service.

communication_identifier.comment: A unique identifier associated with a specific communication channel or method.

domain_name.comment: A domain name is a unique and human-readable address that identifies a website on the internet. It serves as a memorable and recognizable name for accessing websites rather than using numerical IP addresses.

email_address.comment: An email address is a unique identifier used to send and receive electronic messages over the internet. It typically consists of two parts: a username and a domain name, separated by the '@' symbol.

email_excluded.comment: A boolean field that indicates whether the email address is excluded from receiving communications.

email_subscribed.comment: A boolean field that indicates whether the email address is subscribed to receive communications.

environment_type.comment: Environment type refers to the specific purpose of the computing environment. It's categorized into various types such as 'Development', 'Testing', 'Staging', and 'Production'. Each type corresponds to a different stage in the software development lifecycle and is configured to facilitate specific tasks associated with its stage.

home_phone_number.comment: A home phone number is a telephone number that is associated with a residential address, typically used for personal or family communication purposes. It is a phone number that is linked to a landline or a Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) service that is connected to a physical address.

virtual_phone_number.comment: A virtual phone number is a telephone number that doesn't require a physical phone line. It's essentially a digital number that can be used to make and receive calls through the internet.

last_updated.comment: Indicating the last update to the communication property.

password.comment: A password for a computer system is a confidential piece of information that is used to authenticate and verify the identity of a user.

phone_number.comment: A phone number is a unique sequence of digits assigned to a specific telephone line or mobile device that allows it to be reached by a caller. It is typically comprised of a country code, area code, and a specific number assigned to the device.

secret.comment: A secret refers to confidential information for authentication. This value is encrypted when stored.

status.comment: Status of the communication channel indicating its current state, such as active, inactive, or deprecated.

username.comment: A username is a unique identifier or name associated with an individual user. It is used to identify and authenticate users when accessing a computer system, network, or online service.

website.comment: A URL representing the official online presence or digital platform associated with a specific entity, service, or topic. Typically used to provide information, resources, or services over the internet.

work_phone_number.comment: A work phone number is a telephone number that is associated with an individual's place of employment. It is typically used for business purposes, such as to contact colleagues, clients, or customers.

has_communication_validation.comment: A communication validation is a process that verifies the accuracy and validity of communication data, such as email addresses, phone numbers.

contact_person.comment: Uniquely identifies the individual associated with this communication. This the @id of the main person instance returned from save_personal_information.

has_address.comment: Indicates a specific location or postal information.

has_mailing_address.comment: An address describes a physical location described in terms of street address, city, state, region, province, country and other geo-location references.

request_identifier.comment: Identifier value that should be substituted into the source HTTP request to retrieve this specific data.

company_abbreviation.comment: A company abbreviation is a shortened version of a company name.

company_size_value.comment: A qualitative or quantitative value indicating the size of a company, such as 'small', 'medium', 'large', or specific numbers.

company_type.comment: Company type refers to type of company based on its relationship with Staircase.

description.comment: Taxes are fees levied by federal, state, and local governments on income, goods and services, and property, among other things. There are several types of taxes in the United States, such as property tax, income tax, sales tax, payroll tax, excise tax and estate tax.

employer_identification_number.comment: A unique identification number assigned to businesses for tax purposes in specific jurisdictions.

employer_state_identification_number.comment: A unique identification number assigned to a business by the state in which a business resides, for tax purposes in specific jurisdictions.

founded_date.comment: The date on which the company was officially established or incorporated.

industry.comment: The primary sector or category of business activity that a company operates in, such as 'technology', 'healthcare', or 'finance'.

mers_organization_identifier.comment: A unique identifier associated with the Mortgage Electronic Registration Systems.

name.comment: The official name of the company.

has_address.comment: Indicates a specific location or postal information.

has_brand.comment: Associates a company with its specific brand or brands, detailing its identity, logo, and other brand-specific attributes.

has_company_relation.comment: A company relation describes the relationship of a company to another, in terms of the type of relationship, its status, and its nature.

has_finance_relation.comment: Links to financial relationships or transactions.

has_license.comment: Indicates the licenses possessed or required.

has_product_configuration.comment: Product configuration refers to the process of customizing a product to meet specific customer needs and requirements.

offered_contract.comment: A relationship indicating that a company has offered a particular contract.

subscribes_to.comment: Denotes the subscription that customer is currently signed up for or associated with.

api_key.comment: An API key is a unique identifier used to authenticate and authorize access to an API. This key is stored in encrypted format for security purposes.

api_name.comment: API name refers to the name of a partner API.

auth_url.comment: An authorization URL is a specific URL that is used to initiate the process of authorizing access to a particular resource or service. When a user wants to access a resource or service that requires authorization, they are redirected to the authorization URL, where they are prompted to authenticate themselves and grant permissions to access the resource or service.

company_connection_identifier.comment: A company connection identifier is a unique code or number assigned to a company connection for identification purposes.

domain_name.comment: A domain name is a unique and human-readable address that identifies a website on the internet. It serves as a memorable and recognizable name for accessing websites rather than using numerical IP addresses.

environment_type.comment: Environment type refers to the specific purpose of the computing environment. It's categorized into various types such as 'Development', 'Testing', 'Staging', and 'Production'. Each type corresponds to a different stage in the software development lifecycle and is configured to facilitate specific tasks associated with its stage.

has_custom_field.comment: A custom field refers to a user-defined or customized data field that is added to a system, software, or database to store specific information that is unique to a particular organization or user's needs.

password.comment: A password for a computer system is a confidential piece of information that is used to authenticate and verify the identity of a user.

secret.comment: A secret refers to confidential information for authentication. This value is encrypted when stored.

username.comment: A username is a unique identifier or name associated with an individual user. It is used to identify and authenticate users when accessing a computer system, network, or online service.

company_relation_status_type.comment: Company relation status type indicates the status type for the company.

has_to_company.comment: Has_to_company indicates that the company instance is a parent instance that has a child company instance.

datocms_identifier.comment: A datocms identifier is a unique code or string of characters assigned by a remote content management system (DatoCMS) to a data structure or content.  The identifier is used to uniquely identify and access that data structure or content.

datocms_url.comment: A DatoCMS URL is a string of characters that provides a unique internet address for DatoCMS content. The URL enables a console to locate and interact with specific content in DatoCMS.

title.comment: A title is a unique label given to a ticket that is used to distinguish it from other tickets in the Staircase ticket management system. A title typically reflects the purpose of the ticket, and is often designed to be easy to remember and to quickly communicate support needs.

url_suffix.comment: A URL suffix is a string of characters that provides a unique internet address suffix for the console. The URL suffix, when combined with the console name and the environment it is deployed into, enables customers to locate and interact with the console.

has_permission.comment: Permission (in the context of software) refers to the access or authorization granted to a customer, organization or application to perform certain actions or access certain resources within the software.

has_site.comment: Site refers to the parameters and behaviors of a website created using the Console product. The website typically offers functionality related to various Staircase products.

active_investing_indicator.comment: Indicates whether a consumer is actively involved in investing.

amex_regular_credit_card_use_indicator.comment: Indicates whether a consumer uses a regular American Express credit card.

antiques_collecting_interest_indicator.comment: Indicates a consumer's interest in collecting antiques.

antiques_purchase_indicator.comment: Indicates a consumer's purchasing behavior related to antiques.

art_purchase_indicator.comment: Indicates a consumer's purchasing behavior related to art pieces.

arts_broadway_interest_indicator.comment: Indicates a consumer's interest in arts and Broadway shows.

arts_collecting_interest_indicator.comment: Indicates a consumer's interest in collecting arts.

arts_cultural_donation_indicator.comment: Indicates whether a consumer has donated to arts and cultural causes.
